model_answer:
A: Submit a "Temporarily remove URL" request to hide a page from Google Search results.

The speaker explains that you can use the removals report in Search Console to request that Google temporarily hide a page from search results. This option allows you to ask Google to remove a page from search results for a specific period, usually between 7 and 30 days, while still allowing people to access the page through other means (e.g., direct links).

The method to undo a temporary removal request, as implied by both the on-screen pop-up and the speakerâ€™s description of the report, is to use the cancel option in the Temporary removals section to withdraw the request. Therefore, the correct answer is A: Use the cancel option in the Temporary removals section to withdraw the request.
